1.text: Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel;

2.text: To know wisdom and instruction; to discern the words of understanding;

3.text: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice and judgment, and uprightness;

4.text: To give craftiness to the simple, and to the youth, knowledge and meditation.

5.text: The wise one will hear and he will add learning: and he understanding, shall obtain guidance:

6.text: To understand a proverb, and an enigma: the words of the wise and their parables.

7.text: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of knowledge: the foolish despised wisdom and instruction.

8.text: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and thou shalt not reject the law of thy mother:

9.text: For they a garland of grace to thy head, and necklaces for thy throat.

10.text: My son, if they sinning shall entice thee, thou shalt not go in.

11.text: If they shall say, Go with us, we will lie in wait for blood, we will hide for the innocent gratuitously;

12.text: We will swallow them down living, as hades, and whole, as they going down to the pit:

13.text: We shall find precious riches, we will fill our houses with spoil:

14.text: Wilt thou cast thy lot in the midst of us; one purse shall be to all:

15.text: My son, thou shalt not go in the way with them; withhold thy foot from their beaten paths:

16.text: For their feet will run to evil, and they will hasten to pour out blood:

17.text: For gratuitously the net was spread in the eyes of all possessing a wing.

18.text: And they will lie in wait for their blood; they will hide for their souls.

19.text: So the ways of every one plundering plunder; he will take the soul of those possessing it.

20.text: Wisdom will cry without; in the broad places she will give her voice:

21.text: She will call in the head of sound, in the entrances of the gates: in the city she will say her words:

22.text: How long, ye simple, will ye love simplicity? and mockers delight to mock for them, and the foolish hate knowledge?

23.text: Ye shall turn back at my reproofs: behold, I will pour forth my spirit to you, I will make known my words to you.

24.text: Because I called and ye will refuse; I stretched forth my hands, and none attending;

25.text: And ye will reject all my counsels, and ye desired not my reproofs:

26.text: Also I will laugh at your ruin: I will deride in the coming of your terror;

27.text: In your terror coming as a destroying tempest, and your ruin shall come as a whirlwind; in the coming upon you of straits and distress.

28.text: Then they shall call upon me, and I will not answer; they shall seek me, and shall not find me;

29.text: For that they hated knowledge, and chose not the fear of Jehovah:

30.text: They desired not for my counsels: and derided all my reproofs.

31.text: And they shall eat from the fruit of their way, and be filled with their purposes.

32.text: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the error of the foolish shall destroy them.

33.text: And he hearing to me shall dwell in confidence, and being quiet from fear of evil.
